alert.note: Alert for Washington (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 14 at 12:57PM EDT until July 14 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Washington County in the panhandle of Florida... * Until 300 PM CDT. * At 1157 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Vernon, Bradford, Live Oak, Wausau, Sylvania, Smyrna, Spring Hollow, Holmes Valley, Brock Crossroad, Orange Hill, Sunny Hills, Millers Ferry and Gilberts Mill. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
